Bad

Let me start out by stating that despite all its flaws, Daregon is an impressive effort considering the whole game has been developed by just one person. Ustwo games should probably take positive note of the developer and consider hiring him especially since the guy has been honest and outright states that the game is inspired by Monument Valley. Now coming to the game itself, Daregon follows more or less the same formula that Monument Valley had, so mind bending isometric puzzles are par for the course. Daregon adds some interesting new elements inspired by some other games like Hitman Go to the mix. However, the controls are very clunky and the solutions to some of the puzzles are very unintuitive (Example: Having to backtrack to a preceding level twice to change certain things in the current level). The game also suffers from a lack of music and minimal sound effects. All in all, until Monument Valley 2 comes out on Android, this is a decentish filler if you can grab it for free.
